Tool Call.migration_script: CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100), email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE); INSERT INTO users (id, name, email) VALUES (1, 'John Doe', 'john@example.com'); ALTER TABLE orders ADD COLUMN user_id INT; ALTER TABLE orders ADD FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id);

Return Data.rollback_script: ALTER TABLE orders DROP FOREIGN KEY orders_ibfk_1; ALTER TABLE orders DROP COLUMN user_id; DELETE FROM users WHERE id = 1; DROP TABLE users;
rollback_steps: Remove foreign key constraint from orders table
Drop user_id column from orders table
Delete inserted user record with id = 1
manual_steps: Verify no dependent data exists in orders table before dropping foreign key
Backup any existing data before executing rollback script
Check for any application connections using the users table before dropping
